name: Hotel Jan

Hotel was based just off the main square so perfectly place as a base to explore the city.

Here I found sketches by Kacper Kalinowski, whom I have been trying to get for my collection for a long time. I'm not from Krakow, but I will definitely follow the news on the gallery's website in the hope of purchasing gems of Polish painting.

I live in Wrocław and getting there without having to stand in traffic jams and look for a parking lot is a big advantage and saves time. Receiving the purchased painting was stress-free and I used the saved time for a nice conversation with the very competent owner about contemporary trends in painting and the artistic world in Krakow. I recommend

name: Czarna Kaczka/ Black Duck
reviews.text:
Black Duck Restaurant is a fantastic spot for anyone looking to enjoy traditional Polish cuisine at reasonable prices. The dishes are authentic and delicious, showcasing the rich and diverse flavors of Polish cooking.

**Ambiance:**
The restaurant exudes a warm and inviting atmosphere, perfect for both casual dining and special occasions. The décor is tastefully done, reflecting the cultural heritage of Poland, making diners feel they’ve stepped into a little piece of Poland.

**Food:**
We started with the **potato pancakes**, which were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, perfectly paired with a side of sour cream. For the main course, we had the **chicken breast**, which was tender and flavorful, complemented by traditional seasonings. Additionally, we indulged in a **Vodka tasting**, which added a unique touch to our dining experience, allowing us to explore different flavors and varieties of Polish vodka.

**Service:**
The service is exceptional, with friendly and attentive staff who go out of their way to ensure a pleasant dining experience. They are knowledgeable about the menu and are happy to make recommendations or explain the origins of the dishes.

**Overall Experience:**
Our experience at Black Duck Restaurant was nothing short of wonderful. The combination of authentic food, warm ambiance, and excellent service made for an unforgettable dining experience. We highly recommend this gem to anyone looking to explore the rich flavors of Poland.

name: Czarna Kaczka/ Black Duck
reviews.text: Amazing service and delicious local food. The Zurek soup was so tasty and my group loved it. The dumplings also very very good. Definitely worth the visit. We were offered a local vodka at the end of our meal made of cherry (also great). Worth the price and the visit

name: Czarna Kaczka/ Black Duck
reviews.text: The restaurant seems have a good review, so we tried it few months ago. The place is almost always busy. We tried to walk in but no luck so we do reservations, and yes, best to do reservation in advance. It’s served traditional Polish dishes & it’s delicious. The duck is their famous menu. There are some vegan & vegetarian options.

name: Czarna Kaczka/ Black Duck

name: Czarna Kaczka/ Black Duck
reviews.text: Everything was excellent, they gave us a complimentary appetizer of pickles and pate that was great. The mushrooms soup and the duck broth with dumplings were amazing. Service is quite fast and nice.

My salad with goose was fantastic — super fresh especially with the pear pairing. The buckwheat was a bit too oily.
I also tried the beef tartare — not sure about the mayonnaise. It didn’t add anything to the meal nor elevated it. The focaccia that was served along was quite old and dry which I shared with the server. Regardless the meat was done nicely.

name: Hotel Rubinstein
reviews.text:
A very nice hotel. We stayed here for a week over Christmas 2024. The location in Kasimierz is quiet and easy to find. On the market square in front of the hotel you can park for a fee (expensive) and unload easily. There is a cheap parking option (24 hours and guarded) not far away. The room was fitted with parquet floors and was inside, i.e. there was no window to the outside but to the hallway. Fresh air was supplied by an automatic fan, no louder than an air conditioner. It was large and very clean. Room service was great!
We had booked the Christmas package with dinner & brunch. Looking back, the food was delicious but we had expected a lot more for this price. The service was very rushed, the courses were served too quickly and breaks were only taken after we asked. That's what we would have expected at least from a 4-star hotel and dinner.
The Christmas brunch turned out to be a normal breakfast, an excellent breakfast with fresh made egg dishes, but it was no different to the other breakfast days.  And that was disappointing, as it was included in the package.
The manager was present, but we would have liked him to have a better demeanor. For example, at dinner he first looked after his "regulars" (bilingual) and then gave the rest of the guests a quick chat in English. We were there for a week, one of the few long-term guests during that time, and he didn't really need to ask how we were enjoying it. What a pity!
The reception was unfortunately not helpful at all. Parking in front of the hotel was free on all Christmas Days, but that wasn't mentioned. There were also no recommendations for restaurants or places to visit, which is unusual. We didn't have dinner in the hotel's own restaurant, as we weren't impressed by the menu of classic dishes given the wide range of choices in the area. Perhaps this could be improved. Conclusion: It was a nice stay and we would come back. However, we wouldn't book the Christmas package again, as the price-performance ratio wasn't right for us and we expected a lot more for 4 stars.  In general, the hotel is a little old and could do with a bit of sprucing up, not in terms of cleanliness and functionality but rather in terms of wear and tear on carpets, runners, etc.

name: Hotel Rubinstein
reviews.text:
Visited Poland in August 2024 for an long weekend getaway. We were staying locally but visited hotel Rubinstein on our first night for food.

Fantastic service and food, we revisited nearly every day, was nice to sit either inside or in the covered seating area at the back overlooking the square.

Will go back when I am next in the area.

name: Hotel Rubinstein
reviews.text: Stayed for our 4th visit in February  2024. Absolutely  love Poland and the hotel Rubinstein. Booked a suit this time around and we were not disappointed. Room was beyond our wildest expectations. Stall so very welcoming and friendly.  Our advise would be to book now and enjoy yourselves.

name: Hotel Rubinstein
reviews.text:
Nice hotel in a historic square, but not the best stay.

We booked a room with shower over a bath, but sadly only had a shower. I told reception the day we checked in to be told they're full and couldn't change rooms, and this was just the start of our problems.

The room.
We had a really uncomfortable bed with flat pillows, that's left me with back pain. You sank into it and made you feel like you were sleeping on a slant. It was quite an odd bed. We were given room 401, it was right next to the elevator so we had a lot of mechanical noise off that. The next noisy thing was the daily drilling and banging, late at night, 10pm at 2:30am in the morning. It was ridiculous and never experienced anything like this at a hotel. Which kept us awake, with the terrible bed, we both had an awful night sleep. In Hotel Rubinstein's defence I do think the drilling was coming from the building next door, but can't be sure. However, I told reception hoping they would resolve the issue, but only confirmed that Hotel Rubinstein does not have any works going on but did say something quite bizarre, that maybe it was a guest to which I asked, "if it were, would you not be worried about a guest using a hammer drill 2:30am?" But this also fell on deaf ears.

Only 1 window which overlooked other rooms and the backend of a glass elevator.

Food and drink.
Our breakfast was included, hot food was nice but only consisted of a choice of fried eggs, scrambled eggs, hotdog sausages. It's not buffet, you have to order it. The continental breakfast is buffet.

We never tried the evening meal, there are so many restaurants around with plenty of choice and are all reasonably priced. Which is part of the reason why we never dined at Rubinstein, the main reason was we were charged 96.91 Pl for two single jack Daniels and cokes. It was quite costly. Im sure the food is very tasty, but when other establishments are costing around 100 - 200 Pl for food and drinks, 96.91 just for two drinks is a bit too much.

The outside.
It's in the historic Jewish Quarter where Schindlers list was filmed. There is plenty to see and do just on the square outside, but beware the two restaurants either side of the Rubinstein, they will hustle you into their restaurant every time you walk past. It gets quite tiring when you only going back to your hotel room.

Shame, we had high hopes, would love to know who thought it was a good idea to use a hammer drill 2:30am every night.

name: Hotel Rubinstein
reviews.text:
I'll confess that we only entered the Hotel to pop up to the Sky Bar, so I can rate the Rubenstein on Location and Service.

It seems to be in a good spot for sightseeing, the service at the Sky Bar was great and the entrance makes a fine impression.

name: Hotel Wielopole
reviews.text: Best customer service ever from a hotel. So thoughtful. Can help with any tour. Can't recommend staying here enough. Perfect location close to everything. Can't big up the service and staff enough. We will be back!!

name: Hotel Wielopole
reviews.text: Perfect.  Staff in particular are amazing.  Best hotel experience ever.  The keys are sometimes difficult  deal with but it's a very historic hotel and you have to deal with those issues.   Awesome location...sharing parking with holiday Inn. Amazing location and value

name: Hotel Wielopole
reviews.text:
The staff were friendly and the location was good, we were able to easily walk around the city from there and see everything that we wanted to see. They partner with the hotel across the street for parking, since they don't have any dedicated parking, which you can pay for at the front desk. The breakfast was really good, with plenty assortment of hot and cold food items, and the staff will bring you coffee however you like it.

The room was pretty small, but not a big deal for just one night. The fridge was really small as well, we could only fit a couple bottles of water in it.

name: Hotel Wielopole
reviews.text: Great location. Hard to be better connected with whole Krakow. Close to K+R popular tourist pickup/dropoff location. Fair service for fair price.

name: Hotel Wielopole
reviews.text: A real, classic hotel with a 24H reception and a very nice and attentive staff. You can have the coffee you like freshly made with your breakfast. Walking distance from the train station and even closer to the old town but still very quiet and peaceful.

name: Queen Boutique Hotel
reviews.text:
Lovely hotel, staff are very friendly, helpful and can't do enough for you.
Location is excellent, short walk to main square and Jewish Quarters and around a 25 minute walk to the main train station.

Rooms were well maintained and very clean. We had a TV with access to media players and a fully stocked mini bar. (Although we spent very little time in the room).

Breakfast was lovely, always had plenty available, and will cook fresh eggs on arrival.

Would 100% recommend it, and we will be staying again.

name: Queen Boutique Hotel
reviews.text:
A small hotel in a great location for exploring  Krakow and very close to the Jewish Quarter with its great cafes and bars.
The rooms are spacious and very clean .
The staff are really excellent . So polite and helpful . The breakfast has loads of choice and was plentiful.

If there are two small things that could improve the experience even more...
It would have been nice to have  comfortable sofas or seating somewhere near the bar downstairs so we could have enjoyed a quiet relaxing drink. The dining table seating was not ideal for this .
The room scent used in our room 402 was quite overpowering and whilst pleasant , was just too strong.

name: Queen Boutique Hotel
reviews.text: Pleasant one-night stay. Bit worried that the first thing I saw when I walked into my room was ear plugs on the bedside table but to be honest even as a light sleeper it wasn’t really a problem. (Yes there are trams going past but the double glazing seems pretty good.) There is a restaurant and a spa here but this isn’t necessarily a hotel you’d hang out in - for a place to use as a base to get out and explore Krakow it does the job well. It’s about a ten minute walk to the main square and on the edge of the old Jewish quarter with lots of choices of cafes and restaurants if you explore the streets nearby. The buffet breakfast was fine with a good spread - lots of meats and cheeses, befitting the location. All in all, a recommendable choice.

name: Queen Boutique Hotel
reviews.text:
Recently  me and my husband have visited Cracow and we stayed at this hotel. Our rest was fantastic!
Beautiful interior, very helpful service and comfortable room.
Every breakfast was incredible.
Especially we want to thank the cook Marcin for delicious eggs Benedict. We highly recommend this place and advise you to try the chef’s dishes.

reviews.text: Krakow holds a special place in my heart, as I studied architecture here. It was first time while staying at the Copernicus. The hotel was reinstated with the original architectural details and paintings. It's lovely! Staying anywhere else in Krakow would be difficult after staying at Copernicus. Our room had  a great view of the Wawel castle. The hotel's lower ground level also has a small swimming pool and a dry sauna for guests to enjoy. The personnel was excellent. Thank you

name: Hotel Copernicus
reviews.text:
Perfect fine dining but very expensive considering they don't have a Michelin star. Top notch food and delicious wine highly recommend

Beautiful rooms although access difficult to get to the bed in room 208 so would avoid that one if possible. Reception staff very helpful and managed to get us early check-in for no charge due to a very early flight.

Second visit and this time we discovered the roof terrace! If you visit head up to the top floor and up the stairs. Incredible views over the city!

Highly recommended

name: Hotel Copernicus
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights for our honeymoon and absolutely loved it. They were very accommodating and helped us with booking tours and restaurants. The service was incredible - it’s now our favorite hotel that we’ve ever stayed in. You can’t beat the location either. It’s close to everything. We enjoyed drinks on their rooftop terrace every night with an incredible view of Wawel Castle. The hotel is clean and wonderfully decorated. And do yourself a favor and get the breakfast here! It was delicious. I would definitely stay here again!

name: Hotel Copernicus
reviews.text: Such a great hotel in a perfect location. It was adorable and very clean. The workers were super nice too!

name: Hotel Copernicus
reviews.text:
Though the virtue of a hotel  and its stars lie in its grander,  location, ambience , Resturant’s , pools , the spa and Hotel Copernicus   aces in all these accolade.

However at Hotel Copernicus these 5 stars shining most brilliantly in the sky of hotels are pale in comparison to the pleasant smiling faced stars  , in the doorways  ,  the hallways , behind the concierge desk reception desk, the restaurants.
Polish people are very cordial overall cannot be doubted but the staff at this hotel is exceptional.

One has hardly entered the doors when  a reception team welcomes every member of the family individually  and take you to the room efficiently.

I being a discerning    observer of people can write a paragraph on the excellence of service of every employee but I cannot finish the review without mentioning a few words about the Gen manager Joanna who carries a perennial smile on her face and puts a sincere effort to  make every guests stay   indelible .

This letter would not be consummate if I forget to acknowledge  the service and innocent smile of Piotr who is a proud father of  a 3 year old.
The front desk team who I met Martin, Panel and Javer were all very pleasant and willing to do anything with alacrity.
I would recommend it to anyone going to Krakow.

It's in the jeweish quarters which has some nice local bars and restaurants around and not far from old town.
No kettle in the rooms but if you simply ask the concierge, they have one sent up.

I definitely recommend this place for your stay in kraków.

The hotel requires some renovation ,it's quite old style. The breakfast is descent but limited variety which was ok for a 3star hotel. The location was great as its very nearby to all points of interest.Special plus, the driver picked us up for the departure to get us to the airport. Very nice car and very nice and attentive driver.

reviews.text: This is a very aesthetic place with pretty good oysters. Oysters were fresh, and very well cleaned. We had the cheapest option and they were great! We also had the frog legs, which were tasty and cooked well. This was a cute place to take pictures at with their large bathtub, and grab some pre-dinner drinks.

name: Prosecco oyster bar
reviews.text:
Good value for money.
The oysters were good and the baby octopus as well.
Unfortunately I could not taste any prosecco, but they have nice brands made in Italy.
Very likely to come back.

name: Prosecco oyster bar
reviews.text: Nice to find an oyster bar in the area. Service and food was great, but the selection of oysters was limited. I would have liked to see horseradish as an option with my oysters. However, overall I found this to be a great dining experience.

name: Hotel Wentzl
reviews.text:
If you're looking for the best view of Kraków's Main Square (Rynek Główny), I strongly recommend to make a reservation in Hotel Wentzl. The location is excellent, and although the square is busy until late night, the room itself was fairly quiet.
The room is spacious, and has everything you need even for a longer stay, including a very comfortable bed. Staff was friendly, and breakfast fine.
Just a minor subjective note: The furniture and design of the interior is a strange mix of old and new. It seems as if the owners are unsure whether they prefer modern or traditional old interiors. However, this does not diminish the overall comfort offered by this hotel.

name: Hotel Wentzl
reviews.text:
A truly unbelievable location, right on the square, and if you get one of the Suites on the 4th floor, you get your own small balcony you can look down into it from.  The rooms are exceptional, some modern, some traditional.
Overall, a great base to explore from, with friendly staff and at a very good price.
Highly recommended.

name: Hotel Wentzl
reviews.text: Fantastic hotel located right on the old town square.  Boutique hotel with only 19 rooms.  15 of the rooms face the square with amazing views.  The 4 rooms without a view of the square end in 6.  There are rooms on 2nd, 3rd and 4th floors, so, for example, if you are booked in 31, 32, 33, 34 or 35 - you have a view of the square.  36 does not have a view of the square.  Wonderful staff, outstanding location.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND.

name: Hotel Wentzl
reviews.text: Excellent hotel in the centre of Krakow. Walking distance to all places in old town. 2mins to tram. 20mis to bus and train station.. ..Very clean rooms. Nicely decorated and  Very friendly staff. Would stay again

name: Hotel Wentzl
reviews.text:
I would give bonus stars for the location if i could. Super location and an amazing room overlooking the square.
full recommendation.

name: Restauracja Dwór Kościuszko

name: Hotel Ester
reviews.text:
I had the most incredible stay at Hotel Ester over Yom Kippur. It is located on the beautiful cobbled square in the heart of the Jewish Quarter. It’s surrounded by Jewish community and history and it is a very special place. The area is beautiful and has everything you need. You are close to all of the historical sites and also many other things you have to do whilst in Kazimierz.

The hotel is luxurious, extremely clean and feels like you’re home. It’s warm and friendly. It has a real “Mikdash Ma’At” vibe, which is Hebrew for “little sanctuary” and it truly is. I will be returning again. My room was lovely and had all the mod cons you need and expect but within a very traditional room with lots of character. The bed was very comfortable, the room temperature could be easily adjusted with an in room control, the TV had all the channels and Apps you wanted, and the fridge was very cold and surprisingly spacious. I am Diabetic and I was able to store insulin, drinks and milk in the fridge with ease.

The staff were amazingly kind and helpful. They provided me with a bowl and spoon for my room, to use for my own self-catered breakfast. They cleaned my room and changed my sheets on request. They even let me borrow a phone charger on my first night as I had the wrong type of adapter.

There is someone awake and on reception throughout the night. They are aware of every person that enters the building and the hotel is just the right size for them to know who’s supposed to be there and who isn’t. I felt very secure. The location of the hotel is very community orientated too. Quiet and familiar.

You do not have to be Jewish to stay here, but if you are, know that you will be accepted and 100% safe both in the hotel and surrounding area.

I can’t rate this hotel enough. Highly recommend. I urge you to stay here.

name: Hotel Ester
reviews.text: My wife and i stayed at the Hotel Ester 25th to 29th November 2024. It is a lovely cosy hotel, very friendly staff and has all you need for a short city break. It is in a quite location but only a short and easy walk to the lovely old town of Krakow. The hotel was lovely and warm, would recommend anytime if visiting Krakow. Just a note, as you come out of the hotel and turn right there are two restaurants, dont go to the one furthest away as we got ripped off there. There are many great eating places in Krakow that cost half as much. Would stay at the Ester again.

name: Hotel Ester
reviews.text: Great historical hotel. Bed was 👏.  Service was great.  Breakfast included but not much to choose from unfortunately! Location of hotel was spot on as there's plenty of bars and restaurants all around!

name: Hotel Ester
reviews.text:
A lovely hotel in the Jewish quarter.  Rooms clean with TV, kettle and mini fridge
Staff helpful and friendly.  Music played outside most days.  Breakfast was continental and OK
Stayed for 4 nights from 7th April
The area was busy during the day but quiet at night and there were some lovely restaurants and bars not too far away
Would recommend this hotel, we had a great holiday

name: Hotel Ester
reviews.text:
I had a lovely, 4 night stay here last week.  Lovely, clean room, love the quirky decor. Lots of choice for breakfast, good dinner menu, very tasty
Reception staff very helpful
Will definitely stay here again.
Great location. Only 30 minute walk to the old town square

name: Restauracja Tużurek
reviews.text: Restaurant is located in soviet style hotel in the city centre and not easy to find. But it’s worth to be found. We’ve been there for the first time during Restaurant Week and it was a real discovery. Even though decorating is modern but covers on chairs and chairs themselves still reflect soviet style as well as the whole table arrangement. But the food was really good. Not sure if dishes presented to us during Restaurant Week are in the main menu but everything was very creative and tasty with great presentation. Especially squid was just extraordinary. Only dessert could be better, I am a fan of honey cake but this one was not the best. Otherwise just great experience and highly recommended restaurant. Service was very good too.

name: Restauracja Tużurek
reviews.text:
We enjoyed visiting here: the atmosphere is pleasant, the dishes are great - perfectly combined ingredients with beautiful serving.
The staff is nice and helpful.
I really liked my starter and the main dish with seafood as a main ingredient and was surprised how honey cake (medovyk) can be delicious.
I'd say it's worth going there!

name: Restauracja Tużurek
reviews.text: Restauracja Tuzurek serves authentic, delicious Polish cuisine in the creative heart of Krakow - I highly recommend. The steak Tartar was hearty, the trout was tantalizing. And the tart is mouth watering - I will be coming back here as soon as I can.

name: Restauracja Tużurek
reviews.text: The restaurant itself does not look very impressive it is decent. There is however a possibility to sit outside. The food on the other hand is amazing. For starters we had the maczanka po krakowsku  and the żurek. Which where both delicious. For main we had duck leg which was appetizing aswell. They serve great portions too.The service was noteworthy waiter very kind fast and knowledgeable about the menu. Overall a great experience and I definitely recommend going here!

name: Hotel Europejski
reviews.text: We had a great experience here. Staff was very helpful and link us to a service to go to Auschwitz from door to door. Historical building in very good condition. A few blocks away from train station and shopping center across the street. Waking to old Krakow only took a few minutes. Highly recommended!

name: Hotel Europejski
reviews.text:
Pros
Location, jacuzzi tub in the most expensive room
Cons
Where to start... The bed was extremely uncomfortable, the breakfast very basic, the front desk nice but recommended the taxi driver to take us to the airport who was extremely slow, incapable of putting the suitcase into the boot and charged us apparently twice the normal price. The expensive room with the jacuzzi had approach through the garden which in summer maybe nice, but in winter the need to basically go outside and wear coats to for instance eat breakfast, was far from ideal.

Overall I wouldn't recommend.

name: Hotel Europejski
reviews.text: It is very rustic, and has an old European style. It is very clean, room beds and floors are a bit squeeky due to age, but comfortable. Rooms are spacious and bigger than other places. Toilets are modern and clean. I slept in the room facing the garden where it is always quiet and cozy. But the rooms facing the main street could be noisier since there is a tram running, and the building can vibrate a bit. Overall, highly recommend it if you can get it at a good price. Luggage storage and early check in is also possible.

name: Hotel Europejski
reviews.text:
So pity that I don't have the photo of our room.
The rooms have retro style, which is a really nice feeling and the equipment (beds, shower etc.) is high quality. You can feel that the rooms are clean and well equipped at every detail.
The reception, and rest of the team is also very helpful and friendly.

Breakfast on the other hands needs some improvement. Feels like their meal concept is also retro, remained loyal to 70's 80's of Poland.
Second detail is air conditioning, they are also quite old school and quite loud. But you almost never need it since the windows are wide and the room gets a lot of air.

Regarding parking: there are many public parking spots available right in front of the hotel. You can park there between 20:00-10:00 + the entire weekend for free. If you prefer to not drive for a day or so, the hotel has a private and secure parking spot in the back that costs 60pln per night. We parked it early in the morning and kept until checkout the next day. It was a perfect deal.

Thank you for your hospitality.

name: Hotel Europejski
reviews.text: It's incredible that you can stay in the center of Krakow without being exposed to any noise - we had a nice room with windows facing the courtyard. All the services are perfect, the breakfast is delicious. This was our second stay in this hotel, the next visits will definitely be here.

name: Hampton by Hilton Krakow
reviews.text:
We stayed one night. The location is good. There is a Doubltree next door and the hotel’s own parking is there. If you park behind the Hampton, make sure you pay through Apcoa as that place does not belong to the hotel!

The staff was VERY nice and helpful, the service was outstanding! I messed up the booking and booked a twin, totally my fault and they helped me and swapped to a double!

The rooms are nice, the bed was comfortable and the shower was great.

Breakfast is amazing, with so many local and international options.
They also have a restaurant with a limited menu for dinner, also very nice!

I can only recommend and will stay again!

name: Hampton by Hilton Krakow
reviews.text:
Very impressive.  Clean, modern, nice breakfast, attentive staff.
I personally think it is the perfect location: close to a park and trams.  Plus as a Diamond member I have access to the amazing gym and facilities in the Doubletree.
Enjoying my stay!

name: Hampton by Hilton Krakow
reviews.text:
Think twice (or maybe twenty times) before booking a stay at this hotel. At first glance, it seems like a great place—part of a renowned chain, relatively new, with spacious rooms, a comfy bed, a shower cabin, and decent breakfast options. But what you don’t know is what awaits you at night.

Some rooms in this hotel face an inner courtyard, which is completely enclosed by the facades of four buildings. Inside this courtyard are the air conditioning units. If you're lucky enough (like I was) to get a room facing this courtyard, brace yourself for a night straight out of a horror movie. The steady humming of several air conditioning units creates a maddening resonance. And when the night falls and everything else is quiet, that sound will haunt you everywhere.

At around 2 a.m., when you’re on the verge of losing your sanity, the only thing that might save you is a pair of noise-canceling headphones with music playing—because those subtle vibrations even reach your pillow. But after a few hours, the battery of your headphones will die, and trust me, the living will envy the dead.

The hotel reception is fully aware of this nightmare and greets you with a devilish smile when you show up at 2 a.m., saying, "Haha, no other rooms available."

Highly recommended for those looking to test their mental endurance. For everyone else, my advice is simple: RUN...

name: Hampton by Hilton Krakow
reviews.text:
Excellent Hampton quality. Clean and good service with a delicious buffet breakfast. Gym equipment was in good condition too.

Warning, the pool and jacuzzi gets busy and I saw many people lining up and waiting long time to get in.

name: Hampton by Hilton Krakow
reviews.text:
Dear Sara,

I had the pleasure of staying at your hotel from November 22 to 24, and I wanted to take a moment to thank you from the bottom of my heart. Your kindness and attention before my trip truly made a difference, and thanks to you and your amazing team, I am leaving Krakow with wonderful memories of an unforgettable journey.

I deeply appreciate everything you’ve done, and I look forward to the day our paths cross again.

With heartfelt gratitude,

reviews.text: In the past quite ok hotel. Recently deteriorated horribly. Randomness makes it bad. One receptionist absolutely lovely. 12 hours later totally incompetent with pretty arrogant attitude. The manager was the worst among all of it. Not speaking English and ignoring guest request to give out portable heaters to under-heated rooms. Bottom. Never again.

name: Hotel Ruczaj
reviews.text: This is a really nice hotel. It feels very Polish. Rooms comfortable, food excellent, staff attentive. A bit outside the centre but tram and bus links are good. I personally hope to use it again

name: Hotel Ruczaj
reviews.text:
I was long thinking to give five stars, but decided to take one star away (reason later).
The hotel is located in a bit remote place, but this did not matter as it was quiet, peaceful and at morning I was able to wake up to the sound of birds. The room was ok and a big plus from own balcony.
Will come here for sure again!
The negative comes from the restaurant which was catastrophe! On Friday evening I go there hungry and order vegetarian soup with chanterelles. I love those mushrooms, so my expectations were very high. What I received... The vegetarian stock was frozen and heated, the chanterelles as well and the consistency of the soup was something horrible. The chanterelles tasted like old snails.
As a main course I ordered pork loin with potatocake and asparagus. Same thing... the pork loin was precooked -> frozen -> heated -> served. The consistency and taste of it was like eating shoe bottom and had problems even cutting a slice. Asparagus was not fresh (and now is asparagus season!) and the potato cake was microwaved.
I have to say that this restaurant really needs help, if it cannot provide always fresh food, they should simplify the menu.

name: Hotel Ruczaj
reviews.text: It is a very quiet hotel in a suburb of Krakow. The furniture is dated and the bed was not very comfortable. The staff are good though. Recommend it for a cheap stay in a great city

reviews.text: The hotel is located in city centre, very close to the old town. There is a supermarket just in front of the hotel. The room was spacious, very clean and comfortable. Our windows looked to the yard, so it was very quiet. The breakfast was pretty good, with enough variety of food. There is a restaurant in the hotel, so you can have dinner there.

name: Metropolitan Boutique Hotel
reviews.text: The highlight of our 5 night at this boutique hotel was the personal friendly service from all staff. Nothing was too much trouble with a welcoming smile on all occasions. Rooms were clean and comfortable with high ceilings giving a feeling of spaciousness. Breakfasts were outstanding with a huge range of sumptuous food available. Location was central to all attractions but without the noise of busy areas. Excellent experience and great value for money.

name: Metropolitan Boutique Hotel
reviews.text: This hotel is absolutely fabulous. The rooms are spotless and spacious. The staff are so welcoming and friendly. They offered us a packed lunch when we had a day trip booked, which was so nice of them. Highly recommend. Will definitely stay here again.

name: Metropolitan Boutique Hotel
reviews.text:
You'll get treated better than at the Ritz at this place. Overall, Polish hospitality is spectacular, especially at this hotel. Staff  greets you every time by standing up when you walk up to the front desk. Every request is handles with class.

Rooms are super clean and very well maintained.

Location is 7 min walk from old town and it's right there in the Jewish Quarter which is like the super cool area of Krakow.

Close to everything. You will love your stay here.

name: Metropolitan Boutique Hotel
reviews.text:
The hotel was spotlessly clean and very welcoming. My room was spacious with a nice bathroom, it was very cold during my visit but the room was nice and warm.

I think the highlight of this hotel is the location. The main square is a 10 minute walk and the central station about 25/30 minutes.

Another nice bonus is the supermarket right across the street, which was very handy for getting drinks and snacks on an evening.

Nice breakfast selection, not massive but enough for anyones tastes.

Great little hotel for a city break to Kraków and perfect location.

name: Winestone Restaurant
reviews.text: Good food is served here, despite being hotel’s restaurant. Menu is quite simple when it comes to selection, yet we found all what we wanted to have. Plate presentation is nice, eye pleasing. What could be improved is serving time, we had to wait a bit long for mains to arrive despite restaurant being almost empty.

name: Winestone Restaurant
reviews.text: This is not the first time we have come, the presentation, menu, service are all excellent. I didn't have much luck with the dish today - shrimp with caroofel, the Caesar here is delicious.

name: Winestone Restaurant
reviews.text: Located inside Mercure Hotel where I am staying for several days and after seeing their menu and wine list, this restaurant became my go-to-place for quock bites and refreshments before and after my tours.  I gave 5 stars because of wonderful ambiance and fot their decent list of drinks and comfort food menu. I appreciate that they offer and promote their regional wine including as one of the options to claim Mercure's welcome drink voucher.  As a tourist, availability of a drink or dish from the region is important.  I saw some not so nice reviews but my personal experience on several visits are all good. Fast service and the food quality-price ratio is decent.

name: Winestone Restaurant
reviews.text: before my flight I wanted to find something nearby main train station and this restaurant caught my attention. Very disappointed with food, pasta was overcooked and without taste. I expected more. I ate everything because I was hungry. I will not come back ever again. The only advantage - kind staff

name: Winestone Restaurant
reviews.text: Excellent restaurant inside Mercure Hotel. The food portions are tasty and big. The service is great and good value for money

name: LAURELLA, Kraków
reviews.text: I bought this dress the other day and I love the style and quality. The store looks inviting from the street and the aesthetics insides are unmatched. I'm considering buying a second item from the store.

name: LAURELLA, Kraków
reviews.text: The dress arrived within 3 business days. Contact with Customer Service Center is very good, both by e-mail and by phone. I hope everything is back to normal and these were just temporary problems :)

name: LAURELLA, Kraków
reviews.text: Unfortunately, I do not recommend this place. I have been waiting for my parcel for a month. I haven't received it yet, and the brand's regulations state that the parcels will be sent within 5 business days. I have a huge problem contacting the customer service center. The company does not respond to numerous e-mails, does not answer phone calls, there were situations when their phone was switched off or calls were rejected. Additionally, the company advertises its products on social media, mainly on Instagram, as if nothing had happened, as if everything was fine. This is very unprofessional. This leaves many wishes.

name: LAURELLA, Kraków
reviews.text:
Beautiful store, nice service. I tried on the dress, it fit perfectly, I got a new dress packed in a bag and I paid. At home it turned out that the dress of the same size was MUCH smaller. I went there especially to be sure and I was in for an unpleasant surprise. I'm waiting for the matter to be resolved, but for now the opinion is justified. I hoped I was getting what I expected :(
EDIT: I sent this one back, they sent me the measured one (the last piece) and it's fine, apart from the fact that I received it with an alarm clip
I'm changing another disappointment to 1 star. According to the internet, it's open until 7 p.m., I went there on purpose and the door says it's open until 4 p.m

name: LAURELLA, Kraków
reviews.text: Let my opinion be a warning! First, the order took a very long time, then it turned out that the color of the dress was clearly different from reality, so I sent the dress back according to the pattern on the website. I waited 15 days for a refund, but unfortunately I still don't have the money. No response to emails, similarly - no response to messages on other platforms. The ability to leave comments under posts has also been blocked - probably due to the number of negative comments. Girls, be careful! As the company has been very popular over the years, I felt at ease when placing my order. Unfortunately, it lulled my vigilance and I didn't look at the current opinions. My situation is no exception, as evidenced by numerous messages left unanswered under the store's posts. This absolutely doesn't stop the company from sharing new Instagram stories and posts about exclusive in-store discounts. Shame.

name: David Boutique Hotel
reviews.text:
Staying in this hotel was one of the best decisions we made for our European trip in summer 2024. The location is excellent: it's within walking distance of all major sites, yet tucked in a quiet corner of a lively neighborhood. Proximity to the nearby cemetery isn't a downside—it actually adds to the peace, providing a restful atmosphere after a long day exploring Krakow. After getting to know the city, I believe staying in the Jewish Quarter is a better choice than Old Town. Just be mindful of the cobblestone streets if you're bringing a roller bag.

The room was thoughtfully decorated, though quite small, especially the bathroom. The service was above and beyond, from the front desk team to the amazing housekeeping staff and the technician who helped us with the safe. I would absolutely come back and recommend this hotel to friends without hesitation.

name: David Boutique Hotel
reviews.text: This hotel is in the Jewish quarter of the city.  It’s about a 25 minute walk to the Castle.  There were lots of reasonable priced restaurants to eat in nearby.  The rooms are tired but spotlessly clean.  The reception staff were very welcoming and helpful.   It was also very warm for our November visit.  Thank you

name: David Boutique Hotel
reviews.text: The best place to consider while staying in Kazimierz. Clean, comfortable beds. great service, close to all jewish attractions and restaurants.

name: David Boutique Hotel
reviews.text: The hotel is located in the centre of the Jewish Quarter of Kraków. It is a few minutes of walk from three of the historical synagogues still in use. Great restaurants are everywhere – enough for every meal of your entire trip. The room is nicely decorated and on a par with those of typical four-star hotels in Western European or East Asian capitals that would have cost four times the price – value for money! The room has a functional water kettle; plenty of tea bags, coffee powder and sugar packs for free – beyond my expectation. The shower faucet also didn't have much of an issue. However, the Wi-Fi didn't work well and required staff resetting for a couple of times. It could be improved.

name: David Boutique Hotel
reviews.text:
The hotel itself is beautiful,quirky and more like a home from home. staff spoke good English and were very friendly. Rooms were clean, inviting and functional which as all you really need. There were extra little items that made all the difference such as a mini fridge. Downside for me for this hotel was at night it’s quite busy with outside noises. A cafe over the road that was open until all hours was rather loud on the side I was staying on. But the hotel and its amenities outweighed the noise at night.
It’s only a 15 min walk to the main square and there are plenty of food options nearby including a little convenience store just around the corner. Staff were happy to give recommendations on places to eat and things to see and honestly nothing was too much bother for them. If I ever come back to Krakow I would 100% book here again.

name: Express By Holiday Inn Krakow
reviews.text: At check-in, the process was slow, and unfortunately, the staff was not particularly friendly. Throughout our stay, we felt as though they were constantly worried we wouldn’t pay, so they provided every service reluctantly. One evening, at 11 p.m., the receptionist entered our room with a card machine, insisting we pay for dinner immediately – it was a completely surreal experience! At breakfast, they allowed a dog inside that was barking, adding to the chaotic atmosphere. The dining area was so overcrowded that there were no available seats, and many guests were forced to have their breakfast at the bar, some even standing. Overall, our stay was disappointing, as the hotel’s attitude and management were far from the level of hospitality one would expect.

name: Express By Holiday Inn Krakow
reviews.text: Disorganized and uncomfortable stay. Isolated location with a paid parking fee, yet the service was unfriendly. Most amenities were broken, and we had to go outside to the next hotel to eat. The worst part was having staff enter our room late at night to demand payment. I don’t feel safe or relaxed after this experience. Not worth the money at all.

name: Express By Holiday Inn Krakow
reviews.text: This hotel is far from the city center, tucked next to a noisy highway. You’d think parking would be included given the location, but they charge quite a lot. The staff were unfriendly and seemed annoyed to be there. Facilities were a joke – a broken bar, an unusable vending machine, and if you want to swim or eat, you’ll need to walk outside to the neighboring hotel. Breakfast was crowded with barely enough food, and seating meant sharing a table. Not at all relaxing.

name: Express By Holiday Inn Krakow
reviews.text: This hotel is not 4 stars. Not worthy of one star. On arrival we were spoken to with the worst manners i have ever experienced, zero customer services. It shows pictures of a different hotel in their advertising. The pictures are of a hotel across the carpark called the premier. They don't have a pool and it is dark and dinghy. Room was not cleaned all week, strong smell of cigarettes. No amenities and no fridge in room. Can only buy a drink at certain times of the day at the other hotel across the carpark.  Food was not great, but nowhere else to eat within walking distance. Again no restaurant at hotel and had to go to other hotel to eat, even for your breakfast that we paid for as part of the stay through the express hotel. Staff were rude when questioned about pool; that didn't exist. I was then told we could use the pool at other hotel but there was a charge. Room cards did not work, so we couldn't get in our room. Went to reception to sort the situation, where I was told by staff it was my fault. Said I must of had them near my phone. This was not the case. This hotel is a joke and the staff are awful. Krakow is gorgeous so don’t let this review put you off visiting, but do not use this hotel. It will ruined your holiday.

name: Express By Holiday Inn Krakow
reviews.text: The hotel’s location was inconvenient and noisy, situated right by a highway, and they charged extra for parking. The staff were unwelcoming and didn’t show any concern for our experience. Many essential services weren’t functioning, forcing us to go to another hotel nearby just to have meals. To make matters worse, staff came into our room late at night to request payment. Overall, it was an uncomfortable, frustrating, and poorly handled stay.

name: Hotel Junior
reviews.text: I did find a bed bug in the extra bed they brought into my room. But they did take care of it and give me another room. This actually very nice, not nightmarish at all. Breakfast was great. Also there is a gas station within walking distance for sacks or vodka. No side walk though.

name: Hotel Junior
reviews.text: No thanks!  Would not even recommend this place to my worst enemy.  The staff probably wanted to be somewhere else.  We ordered food which arrived by deliveryguy about 1.5 hours later.  Personally, I ordered chicken, but got a snitzel.  I think anyway ... Bad, really bad place.  There are so many better options in Kraków.

name: Hotel Junior
reviews.text: I don't recommend this hotel to anyone!!! Cold in the rooms, extremely poor breakfast, plus!!!! I was forced to leave, because I had mice in my room. The Hotel Manager doesn't know in any way the customer orientation. It was my worst experience in terms of accomodation.

name: Hotel Junior
reviews.text:
While on a tour through central Europe we stopped at this hotel, as I'm going to bed I find bed bugs in the beds and up the walls. Having bed bugs wasn't just confined to our room, but our tour directors who help organize it, kept waking up through the night because they thought they felt biting. We also got blamed for bringing them from Prague, which wasn't the case. There's also no air conditioning.

The good stuff we expirienced, was that we ended up getting a new room that was bigger and that actually had a shower door. Wifi was actually free unlike any of that bs you get in the US.

name: Nobilton Hotel
reviews.text: The hotel is located right near the city center. The room was small but very clean and nice. No AC, but the room had a fan, which was enough for the size. Beautiful balcony with view on the lovely courtyard. Friendly staff.

name: Nobilton Hotel
reviews.text: I loved it here the food was brilliant and the rooms were spotless the staff were so friendly and the location is great me and my mum and dad will be coming back here because it is awsome

name: Nobilton Hotel
reviews.text:
Let's start with the fact that the room I was checked into seemed not only outdated, but also not clean enough. The towels looked like they hadn't been washed in years and there were marks in the bathroom from previous guests.

The service in the restaurant also left much to be desired. The waiters were unresponsive and extremely slow. The ordered dishes did not appear on the table for a long time, and when they were finally served, they left much to be desired in quality. I'm sorry, but for these prices I expect something more sophisticated.

The hotel's internet connection was also a frequent source of frustration. The speed was terribly slow and the connection dropped out frequently. This made my stay here even more inconvenient given that I was on a business trip and dependent on network access.

name: Nobilton Hotel
reviews.text: The only advantage is that it’s close to the old town. Room smells like a restaurant, as the hotel is located above the restaurant. If you close the window there is no fresh air to breathe and when you open it - the street is so busy (even during the night) that it’s impossible to sleep. Another disadvantage that sleep is not possible. After sleeping literally less than 2 hours I wasn’t able to fall asleep because of the noise. Bed - very uncomfortable. Room small and not spacious at all. Summing up - if you don’t mind smelly room definitely you can stay here but they should write that below the hotel is a restaurant and it’s literally next to the busy street. Definitely not coming back to this hotel.

name: Nobilton Hotel
reviews.text:
I wanted to rate for 4.5 but that is not possible.
I liked: The hotel is close to the city center. The price was OK compared to other hotels with similar location. The workers were kind and helpful, and they were speaking also English. The breakfast was delicious, even a few types of fruits were available most day. You could also get warm breakfast by choosing from two types of eggs and sausages. Water, tea or coffee placed in the room could be consumed for free. The liquid hand soap had nice smell. The cleaning of the room was scheduled well not to disturb the guest.
I didn't like: The breakfast is only from 7, so you may not be able to eat if you plan to go to other city that day. The food selection is small, which can be a problem if you stay longer. Some people were shutting the door loudly in the night. It would be worth thinking about doors/ locks closing more quietly. On the other hand, the TV turned off itself around 23:15 even if you watched it very quiet. Although the room was not small, due to the layout it was hard to place things somewhere from the suitcase or pack. It would be worth to reconsider the layout leaving place for the guests belongings.
The internet was mostly OK but sometimes weak.

name: ŚWIT Hotel
reviews.text: I really recommend!

name: ŚWIT Hotel
reviews.text: Good morning. We organized a wedding reception at this hotel. I definitely recommend it.  Great service and organization. The ladies responded quickly to any request from us and our guests. Fantastic food, tailored to everyone's needs, taking into account all our suggestions and excluding our guests' allergens. We are impressed with the decor in the room. The ladies prepared everything the way we wanted it to look. After dark, the entire room was illuminated by thousands of small lights, which created a unique atmosphere. The room was air-conditioned, so even though it was 30 degrees outside, guests could feel comfortable inside. There is also a large parking lot next to the hotel, so there were no problems with the lack of parking spaces for our guests' cars. Thank you to everyone who helped make our special day so successful ❤️❤️❤️

name: ŚWIT Hotel
reviews.text:
Very nice and quiet place :)
The rooms were clean, very large and spacious, the breakfast was delicious and we were surprised by a nice surprise for the children in the morning when they were served Pancake for breakfast :))) with maple sauce and whipped cream ;)
Thank you!!!

name: Hotel Kazimierz I
reviews.text: Excellent hotel with a super friendly, polite staff that informs you about the city, restaurants, etc., perfectly. The rooms, restaurant and rest of the hotel, very adequate and clean. Even the smallest detail makes it ideal, such as having a free hot or cold water bottle dispenser in the hallway. Thank you for a fabulous stay at the hotel and in that beautiful city such as Krakow and I threaten to return repeating the hotel.

name: Hotel Kazimierz I
reviews.text:
Great stay, large room, with double and single bed. Location was is OK, 5 minute walk to tram stops and right in the middle of Jewish Quater. Its in a quiet part of town. Staff were friendly.

Room was serviced daily

Bed was a little uncomfortable, and pillows were not the best, so did not get the best nights sleep.

My room was in a seperate building, although not an issue for me, there was no lift.

Overall in terms price paid, it was good stay and I would stay here again.

There is also a fridge in the room

name: Hotel Kazimierz I
reviews.text:
Not impressed with this hotel. We stayed in the Anex a few yards from the hotel. It is very dated and needs updating.
On arrival with  our 2 friends at 22.00 hours we were given keys to our rooms. Bearing in mind these 2 rooms were booked 6 months in advance, we were on separate floors from our friends.  We asked if we could be on the same floor and were told no by a very surly man on reception.  No reason given.
Our friends took the first floor room which was large and roomy we took the 2nd floor room which was pokey and small with 4 small coat hangers.  We asked to be moved but the surly receptionist said we couldn't until the morning.  We decided to stay in the room as it was only a base to sleep.
We found all the Polish staff at the hotel unfriendly and unhelpful.
The only positive thing about this hotel was the breakfast.  The buffet was amazing with so much choice. This was the reason I gave 2 stars otherwise I'd have only given 1
Would definitely NOT recommend this hotel

name: Hotel Kazimierz I
reviews.text:
Great location for exploring as staff were really helpful. The breakfast was brilliant.
The rooms are good and functional - no complaints

name: Hotel Kazimierz I
reviews.text: We stayed in the anex, which only had rooms there. The room was small on the 3rd floor with no lift. Breakfast was next door in a very nice area and lovely food. Here they had toilets and a lift. Very clean. Nice people.  Another downfall was the seating area if you didn't want to go back to the room, one settee, and one chair at the reception desk. We didn't feel comfortable there, so I booked a room at the hotel m29

They’re a great spot to pop in to see if they have whatever you need. I would definitely recommend checking it out!

If you have the rooms near the bar (like we had) it's going to be noisy! Because in every evening is a party in the garden, cause the club is an independent business and they can do what they want inside a hotel! 🙄
The carpet is so dirty that after 5 minutes in the room, the soles turn black. The pillows smells bad.
The people from the reception are nice, though.

name: DS i Hotel Żaczek
reviews.text:
We stayed there for a school trip.
The rooms were really clean and comfortable, the breakfast were delicious.

name: DS i Hotel Żaczek
reviews.text: The “hotel” is really just you renting a room in a student residence, although the room was very clean, quiet, and comfortable. The location allows you to get to the old city and tourist attractions within ten minutes and parking is free. The only downsides are staff have almost no English skills and the inside of the dormitory is a maze, it is very hard to get to and find your room. For the price though I can’t complain. Definitely would recommend for budget-minded travellers visiting Kraków.

name: Lastrada Catering Sp. z o.o.
reviews.text:
We had a big event this week and worked with Lastrada Catering in Krakow for the first time. It was great. The food was very tasty, beautifully presented, the co-operation was very good and reliable. We were delighted and can recommend the company 100%.
We would choose them again! Thank you very much for the great cooperation!!!!

name: Lastrada Catering Sp. z o.o.
reviews.text:
I just wanted to thank you and your team for providing us with an amazing Christmas dinner. Everything was set up beautifully and tasted really great!
Thank you again and I hope we will be able to use your service in the close future again :).

name: Lastrada Catering Sp. z o.o.
reviews.text:
Encouraged by a friend, I chose Catering Lastrada to organize a company picnic...
And it was a hit!!!
Super professional service, great food, clean and elegant equipment.

I heartily recommend it!
Additionally, a great Manager - Marianna :)

name: Lastrada Catering Sp. z o.o.
reviews.text: We highly recommend the catering service from LaStrada to anyone who wants to organize a buffet that not only looks beautiful but also one from which guests are happy to help themselves and after trying one thing they want to try everything as soon as possible! We couldn't have chosen a better choice - we didn't choose the menu, we relied entirely on the selection of LaStrada employees - during the three-day event, each day we received a different, well-composed and surprising set of delicacies (both meat and vegetarian ones received a lot of praise). A huge advantage is trouble-free communication and extremely punctual deliveries and pickups, which allowed us to focus on our guests. I recommend it for larger celebrations and corporate events!

name: Lastrada Catering Sp. z o.o.
reviews.text: Recommended! Very tasty and beautifully presented food. And the cakes are a thing - especially the cheesecake with peaches :)

name: Grand Ascot Hotel
reviews.text: Wonderful stay at the Grand Ascot Hotel. Room was spotless, staff were lovely and its a great surrounding area. Close to food venues and not far frm shops. Ideal for a short break in Krakow!

name: Grand Ascot Hotel
reviews.text: The Grand Ascot hotel in Krakow is an amazing hotel just few minutes away from the old square of Krakow. Our twin room was exceptional, the biggest room I've ever had in Europe, very clean, with an enormous bathroom and great facilities. Our breakfast was included in room's price.  It was quality and enough to start our day. My only comment concerns the soft mattress. I'd prefer one with better support at the edge of the bed. The staff is friendly and they met all our requirements. Thank you for our stay!!!

name: Grand Ascot Hotel
reviews.text:
Amazing stay ❤️
Firstly we would like to thank all your staff for our fantastic stay at your beautiful hotel.
Secondly we would like to thank you from the bottom of our heart for everything you did for us after we stupidly left our belongings in the safe.
You responded to our phone call impeccably in getting our belongings sent via taxi to the airport.
You went above and beyond our expectations and we will never forget this.
The hotel is spotlessly clean, rooms cleaned every day and beds changed every day.
The hotel is in a fantastic location close to everything.
Breakfast in the hotel is lovely and something for everyone
Thank you Grand Ascot you are the best 🥰
Kindest regards
Mr & Mrs Livesey Room 101

name: Grand Ascot Hotel
reviews.text: Loved this hotel, everything was perfect. Great location, fabulous room, lovely staff and great breakfast. Couldn't fault anything and would recommend.

name: Grand Ascot Hotel

The staff is not very friendly and most of the time won’t even greet you when you enter the hotel. One positive aspect of the hotel is the location which is very close to downtown. Also, there are many restaurants nearby.

reviews.text: Highly recommend this place. The room was spacious, the staff very friendly. The breakfast buffet was quite decent. The location is very good: calm area and by foot the center is just 20 minutes away.

name: Benefis Boutique Hotel
reviews.text: Clean and close to the old town center, you will find wawel castle, old town and hebrew neighborhood all within 10 to 20 minutes walk. There is a city bus station 1 minute from the hotel entrance. The staff was friendly enough and there was always someone at the reception without even the need to call them. The only downside was the room temperature which was too high and even when we lowered it on our end, we kept on waking up in the middle of the night sweaty. All in all a very good place to stay in Krakow.

name: Benefis Boutique Hotel
reviews.text:
What a great find 👌🏨👍a lovely boutique hotel near the centre of town.  Each room has a living area with a nice sofa for you to relax at the end of a long day.  The staff are super friendly and helpful.  On our first night we ask for a dinner recommendation. They booked  us into this lovely french restaurant which was one of the best meals we had during our trip.  Price value for money 💰 5 out of 5
Highly recommended.

name: Benefis Boutique Hotel
reviews.text:
Midweek,  two night stay.  Room was massive and clean ... maybe a little worn in places.
Breakfast was great , with a wide variety ( both hot and cold ).
Staff on reception were perfect ... spoke excellent English, polite and helpful ( the man with the moustache was the best I've seen in hotel receptions ).
Finally , the price was simply amazing.
Thank you.

name: Benefis Boutique Hotel
reviews.text:
Lovely hotel located in a quiet area with plenty of character and excellent access to the main sites.

The staff are exceptional and dedicated to providing you with a pleasant stay.

The room was very spacious and comfortable and equipped with all of the amenities you would need.

The breakfast was great and as we had an early morning flight on our second day they made us a packed lunch to take with us.

Thank you so much to the staff for all your efforts it was very much appreciated

Will definitely be back

reviews.text: A very cozy place with excellent cuisine. Although the menu is not very large, you can try burgers and pasta in almost any establishment in the city. All the dishes I tried here are very tasty. I also have to mention the quite tasty desserts. Despite the fact that the restaurant is located in the center, there is always a free table here. I definitely recommend it.

name: Brasserie L'Olympique
reviews.text: Really nice French restaurant. We enjoyed every meal, everything was really tasty! Staff is also really nice and friendly, will help you to choose. Perfect place for the date, romantic atmosphere and beautiful interior.

name: Brasserie L'Olympique
reviews.text:
I would suggest to make a reservation. The food is delicious and beautiful, wonderful place and atmosphere! The prices are very normal. The desserts here are WOW!
With mango and Dulce de leche, I think, Amazing!!!

name: Brasserie L'Olympique
reviews.text: Delicious breakfasts, which is a rarity in Krakow. The dessert was very impressive, also delicious, the presentation of the dishes was beautiful. The atmosphere of ancient France in Krakow.

name: Brasserie L'Olympique
reviews.text: This was definitely going to be a 5 star review. The food is very good and the restaurant very comfortable. Our server was very accommodating and made sure my friend had gluten free bread with her starter, our main course was very good too, then we waited for our plates to be cleared. After around 30 minutes I went to ask the 2 waitresses who were chatting at the counter when someone would clear out plates and offer us dessert. She asked me who my waitress was because they only deal with their own tables! I told her it wasn't my issue to know who my waitress was! And could she please sort it out. Turns out the very pleasant woman who I think was the restaurant manager had served us but had had to go and deal with something. She apologized and I said I felt sorry for her that her team had let her down. As I said the food is excellent and this would have been a 5star review. We hadn't asked or expected a discount but thank you for that.

name: Restauracja Kraków Andromeda Alfa
reviews.text:
Very impressed overall and big plus for the waiter being quite friendly and attentive. Menu prices were very reasonable too. Definitely recommend this place.

It’s a small restaurant in the Galaxy Hotel ground floor. We were first pleasantly surprised by the small roll plate with smalec, followed by the soup and mains. I had tripe and admittedly it wasn’t the style I personally prefer, but that’s because there are many. The veggies were still a little crunchy, but that’s a stylistic element. The mains were excellent. A little low on the salt, but it lets you avoid hypertension too.

It’s a small location, but in the early afternoon we were the only diners.

name: Restauracja Kraków Andromeda Alfa
reviews.text: As you could see everything looked incredible but, unfortunately not all dishes were as I expected or as good as they look. The chocolate tart had a little flavor of onions and the chicken dish was a bit unseasoned. But overall it was a pleasant experience and from my point of view or my point of taste, everything was cooked well but some things were not properly seasoned. The Restaurant is looking really elegant and the staff was really friendly.

name: Restauracja Kraków Andromeda Alfa

Fine dining place, pleasant service and very delicious food. Great place for special occasion.

Recommended

name: Hotel Florian Kraków

Not a 3 star hotel

This is declared everywhere as a 3 star hotel (booking, tripadvisor, etc.), but have only two star certification, which is questionable.
Room is in terrible conditions. Terrible smell, walls are old and require renovation. Dust seemed to be there for ages. There is no bed, bud the sofa. The blanket cover has a hole from a cigarette.
The construction site outside is a good replacement for the alarm clock and wakes you up 6 AM even if you arrived at 3 AM. Closing the window doesn't help that much, and you can't do that, because of the smell in the room.
The stuff is unpleasant. The owner of the place called me crazy when I raised this questions with him.
Even if it will be the last available place in Krakow, I would still not recommend staying there.

Bar/restaurant was confusing to use due to a lack of information about times.

name: Ostoya Palace Hotel

One very important thing for me though, the wi-fi, it's horrible, at least in my room. It is practically non-existent... It comes on for a little while and then just goes away. First reaction of receptionist Jacob “nothing else is available”, second reaction “i don’t have a particular note in my system about your request for a queen bed”. I showed my booking details in the app, Jacob again started blaming booking.com, still NO APOLOGIES for the hotel’s mistake. Sent a house-keeping to put 2 beds together. I again asked Jacob if our terrace looks like a castle, answer “oh, I know it’s not what is expected, but we still consider it as a partial castle view”. They need to upgrade their routers or something to be able to handle the large conferences they claim to be able to do. The meeting spaces themselves are nice and the catering was tasty, so not a terrible experience. Would work well for a low tech conference where not everyone needs to be on their laptops at the same time.

name: Hampton by Hilton Krakow
reviews.text:
Think twice (or maybe twenty times) before booking a stay at this hotel. At first glance, it seems like a great place—part of a renowned chain, relatively new, with spacious rooms, a comfy bed, a shower cabin, and decent breakfast options. But what you don’t know is what awaits you at night.

Some rooms in this hotel face an inner courtyard, which is completely enclosed by the facades of four buildings. Inside this courtyard are the air conditioning units. If you're lucky enough (like I was) to get a room facing this courtyard, brace yourself for a night straight out of a horror movie. The steady humming of several air conditioning units creates a maddening resonance. And when the night falls and everything else is quiet, that sound will haunt you everywhere.

At around 2 a.m., when you’re on the verge of losing your sanity, the only thing that might save you is a pair of noise-canceling headphones with music playing—because those subtle vibrations even reach your pillow. But after a few hours, the battery of your headphones will die, and trust me, the living will envy the dead.

The hotel reception is fully aware of this nightmare and greets you with a devilish smile when you show up at 2 a.m., saying, "Haha, no other rooms available."

Highly recommended for those looking to test their mental endurance. For everyone else, my advice is simple: RUN...

name: Hampton by Hilton Krakow
reviews.text:
Excellent Hampton quality. Clean and good service with a delicious buffet breakfast. Gym equipment was in good condition too.

Warning, the pool and jacuzzi gets busy and I saw many people lining up and waiting long time to get in.

name: Hampton by Hilton Krakow
reviews.text:
Dear Sara,

I had the pleasure of staying at your hotel from November 22 to 24, and I wanted to take a moment to thank you from the bottom of my heart. Your kindness and attention before my trip truly made a difference, and thanks to you and your amazing team, I am leaving Krakow with wonderful memories of an unforgettable journey.

I deeply appreciate everything you’ve done, and I look forward to the day our paths cross again.

With heartfelt gratitude,

reviews.text:
We had a very peaceful time at Esterante.
The meal was delicious and the waistress was very nice.
Furthermore, the place is really adapted for kids.
We highly recommend !

name: Restauracja Esterante

name: Pub Polski
reviews.text: One of the best places we ate at in the Main Square.  Service was 10/10.  We decided (since it was our last day) just to spread our dinner out and enjoy between drinks.  Had a beer, a starter, some more drinks and main, and finally after a few more, we shared an apple strudel!!  We stayed and watched the world go by until sunset.  Lots to chose from on menu. Highly recommend this place.  👌

name: Pub Polski

We stopped here for cocktails on our first day while we waited for our hotel check in time.

The cocktail menu is pretty expansive and the prices are good for being right on the main square. It's an excellent place to just sit and watch the world go by.

Service is attentive and friendly.

name: Pub Polski

name: Pub Polski

name: Hotel Saski Krakow, Curio Collection by Hilton
reviews.text:
Our stay at Hotel Saski Krakow was absolutely spectacular! The building’s rich history, being over 200 years old, paired with the modern luxury of the hotel (opened in 2022) made for an unforgettable experience. The service and attention to detail were impeccable, and we especially loved the heated bathroom floors—such a nice touch.

The breakfast was fantastic, with a special highlight on the local Polish foods, which added a cultural experience to our mornings. Drinks at the Regale Bar were equally amazing—10/10 all around! This is easily one of the most memorable stays we’ve ever had and now ranks at the very top of our experiences with any Hilton brand hotel. Highly recommend!

name: Hotel Saski Krakow, Curio Collection by Hilton
reviews.text:
Hotel Saski Krakow Curio Collection by Hilton entirely corresponds to its 5 star title, starting from the thoughtful interior design and finishing but not limited to delicious breakfasts. All areas of the hotel were sparkling clean and tidy, so was our room. The staff is always friendly and helpful. At breakfasts we were welcomed by smiling hostesses offering us a glass (or more) of prosecco. The breakfasts were impressive-  with a big selection of local meats and cheeses, yogurts and pastries, freshly made smoothies, fresh vegetables and fruits, as well as different kind of pickles, al a carté menu for egg dishes. The presentation of food in the buffet was excellent- always full plates and trays with lavish quantities. The smoked salmon and freshly cut prosciutto were my favorites, as well as pickled mushrooms.
The location is exceptional too- within a walking distance from all major sights and the train station, 30 meters from the old city main square, yet in a quiet street. There was no noise disturbance at night at all, though we were visiting Krakow during the Xmas holidays. Every word of the hotel’s advertising is true to fact and can be trusted. This was our first time in Krakow which appeared to be very enjoyable owing very much to the atmosphere of the hotel. Next time we’ll ultimately stay in this hotel.

name: Hotel Saski Krakow, Curio Collection by Hilton
reviews.text:
Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on a short trip to Krakow, and it was awesome!
We were luckily upgraded on arrival to a one bedroom suite, we stayed a Sunday and Monday night so that along with being a hh diamond member I’m sure aided in the upgrade.
The room was fantastic lots of space, comfortable bed, decent pillows by hotel pillow standards. Huge bathroom with a separate standalone shower and tub, complete with heated floors.
The staff at the front desk were great, very polite and helpful, and nothing seemed to much trouble.
Breakfast had a big selection, a lot of sweets and fruits, as well as the standard bacon, egg, pancakes etc.
The spa is also very good, and prices are reasonable for the services provided in the high end hotel environment.
The location of this hotel couldn’t have been better, minutes walking away from restaurants, bars and shops. Surrounded by beautiful buildings and architecture.
If you’re visiting Krakow, this is the hotel you want to be staying at.

name: Hotel Saski Krakow, Curio Collection by Hilton
reviews.text: Very pleased with the location. Only a few steps from where I want to be and very convenient to access other transit. Staff are friendly and helpful but my only concern was my room. I was booked with an adjoining room which is perfect for family gatherings but not as a one person stay. Noise from adjoining room was loud and there was no need for a alarm clock. Persons made sure you woke up the same time they did. Stay away from room 327...but in all honesty,  I would stay at this hotel again  and I highly  recommend  this  place

name: Hotel Saski Krakow, Curio Collection by Hilton
reviews.text: had the most fantastic stay here, so close to everything. Rooms were so clean, and large.  The Hotel Staff were all so nice and helpful, breakfast was great, would definitely stay here again
